conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, analyze the slopes of the v-t graph.
Particle A accelerates from t = 0 to t = t_0.
Particle B accelerates from t = 0 to t = 5t_0.
Calculate the acceleration of particle A: The initial velocity of A is 0 and it reaches a velocity of 2v_0 at t = t_0. The slope (acceleration) of A is a_A = 2v_0/t_0.
Calculate the acceleration of particle B: The initial velocity of B is 0 and it reaches a velocity of v_0 at t = 5t_0. The slope (acceleration) of B is a_B = v_0/5t_0.
Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations: The ratio is (2v_0/t_0) / (v_0/5t_0) = 10.
